Prerequisite: GERM 210 or equivalent
This course explores the interdisciplinary field of German language literatures and visual arts, and covers literary and artistic movements such as Naturalism, Symbolism, Impressionism, Expressionism, Dadaism and Surrealism. With a focus on early 20th century authors and artists, such as Arno Holz and Christian Morgenstern, Rilke and Rodin, Else Lasker-Schüler and Franz Marc, Oskar Kokoschka and Wolfgang Paalen, Hannah Höch and Raoul Hausmann, Hugo Ball and Kurt Schwitters, we will ask for the interrelationships between images and texts. Other topics include photomontage, concrete and visual poetry. We will also apply selected theories on space and image by de Certeau and W.J.T. Mitchell.
courseName: Selected Topics in German Literature - SEL TPC GERM LIT
description: A study in depth of one topic of special interest, varying from year to year depending on interests of faculty and students. Possible topics: literature and film, the image of the outside world in German literature, individualism and conformism.
